What PRISMA is
What PRISMA is

• Program Review for Information Security Management Assistance is PRISMA
• Program Review for Information Security Management
Assistance is PRISMA

• Published by NIST in 2007 • Security Maturity Model with an corresponding database
• Published by NIST in 2007
• Security Maturity Model with an corresponding database

• Used to establish a baseline score card of security maturity and for continuous monitoring
• Used to establish a baseline score card of security • U s e d
t o
e s t a b l i s h

s c o r e

o f

maturity and for continuous monitoring

•At the Department level and at the program/bureau level •Promotes transparency and focuses accountability
•At the Department level and at the program/bureau level
•Promotes transparency and focuses accountability

• Briefed to Congress and recommended by CSIA in 2008
• Briefed to Congress and recommended by
CSIA in 2008

P R I S M A

How PRISMA works
How PRISMA works

• PRISMA Assessment is conducted in two parts
• PRISMA Assessment is conducted in two parts

• Documentation Review
• Documentation Review

• Are the policies and procedures documented, accurate, and readily available? • Is security part of integrating programs (SDLC, PM, CPIC, EA) and mission delivery?
• Are the policies and procedures documented, accurate, and
readily available?
• Is security part of integrating programs (SDLC, PM, CPIC,
EA) and mission delivery?

• Interview Review
• Interview Review

• Are security policies and procedures improved as part of the security program life cycle? • Are security policies and procedures implemented (followed by the site personnel, integrated into normal operations)?
• Are security policies and procedures
improved as part of the security program
life cycle?
• Are security policies and procedures implemented (followed
by the site personnel, integrated into normal operations)?

PRISMA 2 parts common sense 1 part intuition 1 part knowledge 1 part experience
PRISMA
2 parts common sense
1 part intuition
1 part knowledge
1 part experience

Sample PRISMA Scorecard
Sample PRISMA Scorecard

Legend: Green = fully compliant
Legend: Green = fully compliant

Yellow = partially compliant Red = non compliant
Yellow = partially compliant
Red = non compliant

Scorecards are also generated for subtopics in each of the 9 topic areas.
Scorecards are also generated for subtopics in each of the 9 topic areas.

– Maturity Scorecards in 9 topic areas, 30 subtopic areas

• This can be done for a Department and at a Program or Site level
• Score can be aggregated to Department overall scorecard

Observations from Federal
Observations from Federal

Agencies (1)
Agencies (1)

• Information security does not receive the needed attention by leadership, and it is one of many functions that compete for scarce resources only after meeting operational needs
• Information security does not receive the needed
attention by leadership, and it is one of many functions
that compete for scarce resources only after meeting
operational needs

•Executive management is out of touch with the maturity of their security program • Executive management does not see cyber security as a major threat to mission accomplishment
•Executive management is out of touch with the maturity of their
security program
• Executive management does not see cyber security as a
major threat to mission accomplishment

• The organization has not developed a risk-based approach to information security based upon a clear understanding of threats to information and information systems
• The organization has not developed a risk-based
approach to information security based upon a clear
understanding of threats to information and information
systems

Lessons learned from Federal
Lessons learned from Federal

Agencies
Agencies

• Money spent on security is often not used properly or accounted for properly
• Money spent on security is often not used properly or
accounted for properly

• Not a single agency considered the lost of public trust in the agency as a potential cost
• Not a single agency considered the lost of public trust in the
agency as a potential cost

• Executive management is often disconnected from what the security group is doing and is often surprised by the PRISMA grade
• Executive management is often disconnected from
what the security group is doing and is often
surprised by the PRISMA grade

• IT managers have learned how to game the FISMA report
• IT managers have learned how to game the FISMA report

Managements’ Reaction
Managements’ Reaction

• PRISMA results have traditionally indentified significant weaknesses in “real protection”
• PRISMA results have traditionally indentified significant
weaknesses in “real protection”

• Security management and practioners typically acknowledge and understand the results
• Security management and practioners typically
acknowledge and understand the results

• When informed of the PRISMA assessment results -
• When informed of the PRISMA assessment results -

• Executive management reaction is typical of someone hearing they have a fatal illness

Black Swan Effect and Security
Black Swan Effect and Security

• 5 stages of grief – These are played out when bad news is received
• 5 stages of grief – These are played out when bad
news is received

1. Numbness & Denial 2. Yearning & Anger
1. Numbness & Denial
2. Yearning & Anger

3. Organizational Despair & Sadness
3. Organizational Despair & Sadness

4. Reorganization
4. Reorganization

5. Letting go and Moving on
5. Letting go and Moving on

In closing
In closing

• PRISMA provides a life cycle view of security to establish a program baseline
• PRISMA provides a life cycle view of security to
establish a program baseline

• It can be rerun annually to gauge progress
• It can be rerun annually to gauge progress • I t
c a n
b e
r e r u n
a n n u a l l y
t o
g a u g e
p r o g r e s s

•Security is a foundational process that must be integrated in with how business is done and equated with successful mission accomplishment • Integrate into the culture at all levels • Transparent
•Security is a foundational process that must be
integrated in with how business is done and equated
with successful mission accomplishment
• Integrate into the culture at all levels
• Transparent

•When unexpected news is received
•When unexpected news is received

• Don’t shoot the messenger – listen and evaluate • Stay the course -- Messengers need to be prepared to support the results through the initial phases of both denial and anger
• Don’t shoot the messenger – listen and evaluate
• Stay the course -- Messengers need to be prepared to
support the results through the initial phases of both denial and
anger
